subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: Oscar De La Hoya said he wanted to fight at least a few more times after taking on Manny Pacquiao on Dec. 6 in Las Vegas, in what is sure to be the biggest fight of the year. De La Hoya broke box-office and pay-per-view records with a narrow loss to Floyd Mayweather Jr. last year, and he said that fight proved he could still compete at an elite level. De La Hoya had announced he would retire after this year and focus on his many business interests.
